curam.util.client.model

Interface DomainsContext

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Context
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    RendererContext

    public interface DomainsContext
extends Context
    A context that provides access to domain information. Domains can be retrieved by their name, or by the name of a code-table.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ClientDomain getDomain(java.lang.String domainName)
      Gets a client domain object given a domain name.
      ClientDomain getDomainForCodeTable(java.lang.String codeTableName)
      Gets a domain associated with the named code-table.

    • Method Detail

      • getDomain

        ClientDomain getDomain(java.lang.String domainName)
                throws DomainException
        Gets a client domain object given a domain name.
        Parameters:
        domainName - The name of the domain.
        Returns:
        The client domain.
        Throws:
        DomainException - If the domain is not found.

      • getDomainForCodeTable

        ClientDomain getDomainForCodeTable(java.lang.String codeTableName)
                            throws DomainException

        Gets a domain associated with the named code-table. There is no guarantee that the modeled domain (from UML) associated with that code-table will be returned; a new domain may be returned instead. It is possible to create code-tables at run-time and for which no domain was ever modeled, so a new domain must be created in this case. The new domain will be based on the CODETABLE_CODE domain and will inherit all of that domain's configuration.

        Implementations of this interface method may throw an UnsupportedOperationException if they do not support the retrieval of domains for code-tables.

        Parameters:
        codeTableName - The name of the code-table for which a domain is required.
        Returns:
        A domain associated with that named code-table.
        Throws:
        DomainException - If the domain cannot be retrieved.
